intro: Erysimum kotuchovii, commonly known as the Kotuchov's wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many familiar garden plants such as cabbages and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a desirable plant for rock gardens and alpine displays.
